So I looked at the link you provided, and that first picture and descriptio=
n ("Naval Officers dirks") looks almost exactly like mine.  That's probably=
 what this one is.  That description says that they were first issued in th=
e 1880's, so maybe it is just old enough that it had been "handed down" one=
 generation or something (making it an "heirloom").  I didn't see anything =
that could be considered a hamon, but I also figured I didn't really know w=
hat I was looking for/at.

--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, <nixe@...> =
wrote:
>
> Sue
> 
> where are you located? if one of us are in your area we=
 could arrange to see it. The tanto is a Navy officer's dirk, they were mad=
e from early 1900's through WWII. Some had hand made blades but most had ma=
chine made blades. If you google Japanese Navy Dirk you might see others li=
ke yours. Not sure what else you need, let us know
> 
> mark
> nixe@...
